data.Name: Production-based carbon emissions
data.Definition: emissions related to the production process in the economy. This is carbon emitted from the burning of fossil fuels like coal and oil, and gas for energy production and industrial production of materials (such as cement, steel and other industrial processes in Uzbekistan.

data.Name: Carbon productivity of the economy
data.Definition: amount of output (in GDP produced per unit of CO₂ emitted in the production process of the country). USD/kg of CO₂ emissions. The indicator provides an overview of how Uzbekistan is progressing in reducing carbon emissions from production, and it reflects the trends in the transition to a low-carbon economy.

data.Name: TPES
data.Definition: energy input found in nature before transformation to final forms of energy for end-use such as electricity or petrol for transport. It   includes non-renewables (coal, oil, natural gas), minerals and renewables.
data.Source: Statistics Agency under the President of the Republic of Uzbekistan

data.Name: Energy productivity
data.Definition: Income (in GDP) generated per unit of TPES in the process of production. GDP (in USD 2015) per toe energy use. The indicator measures the economic benefit of using a unit of primary energy. It indicates whether Uzbekistan is becoming more energy efficient,  generating more output from a unit of energy.

data.Name: Energy intensity
data.Definition: the ratio of primary energy consumption over GDP measured in constant US dollars. Energy intensity measures the amount of energy consumed per unit of GDP to identify how efficiently a country uses energy to produce a given amount of economic benefit. Total energy consumed per unit of GDP. This is the inverse of energy productivity and shows the rate of efficient energy use.
data.Source: Statistics Agency under the President of the Republic of Uzbekistan

data.Name: Share of renewable energy supply
data.Definition: the proportion of primary energy generated from hydropower, solar, wind, biomass, waste, geothermal, wave and tidal sources.. Percentage of renewable energy of total primary energy supplied TPES (in toe), million. The indicator helps measure the share of low-carbon   renewable energy sources in the total energy mix supplied/consumed in Uzbekistan

data.Name: Share of renewables in electricity generation
data.Definition: the share of electricity generated from renewable sources of energy, including hydropower, solar, wind, biomass and geothermal sources. Percentage of renewable sources in total electricity generation. It helps show if Uzbekistan is progressing towards a low-carbon electric system.
data.Source: Statistics Agency under the President of the Republic of Uzbekistan

data.Name: Energy consumption by sector
data.Definition: Percentage share of TPES consumed by the agriculture sector. This indicator shows the trends for identifying which sector uses most of the energy supply

data.Name: Energy consumption by sector
data.Definition: Percentage share of TPES consumed by the service sector. This indicator shows the trends for identifying which sector uses most of the energy supply.

data.Name: Energy consumption by sector
data.Definition: Percentage share of TPES consumed by the industry sector. This indicator shows the trends for identifying which sector uses most of the energy supply.

data.Name: Energy consumption by sector
data.Definition: Percentage share of TPES consumed by the transport  sector. This indicator shows the trends for identifying which sector uses most of the energy supply.

data.Name: Energy consumption by sector
data.Definition: Percentage share of TPES consumed by the buildings sector. This indicator shows the trends for identifying which sector uses most of the energy supply.

data.Name: Domestic Material Consumption (DMC) productivity
data.Definition: output in the economy generated from using a unit of material materials biomass, non-metal and metal material resources (in terms of weight) used in an economy (i.e., materials extracted or harvested in the country, plus materials and products imported, minus material and products exported

data.Name: Water productivity
data.Definition: Value-added in GDP (2015 USD) per cubic metre of abstracted water. It shows whether Uzbekistan is using its water resources efficiently.

data.Name: Fertiliser use
data.Definition: the quantity of plant nutrients used per unit of arable land. Fertiliser products cover nitrogenous, potash and phosphate fertilisers.

data.Name: Household solid waste
data.Definition: Total solid waste generated by households in a year. The SA started collecting such data on SW generated and recycled since 2016 as part of SDG monitoring
data.Source: Statistics Agency under the President of the Republic of Uzbekistan

data.Name: Renewable freshwater resources flow
data.Definition: The amount of freshwater in billion m3 that Uzbekistan withdraws annually for different purposes.

data.Name: Water stress
data.Definition: This measures water withdrawal intensity- water withdrawal as a percentage of available water resources.  The level of water stress can show the degree to which the country exploits its water resources to meet water demand. The SA also reports on this indicator as part of the clean water goal.

data.Name: Water consumption
data.Definition: the level of freshwater withdrawal by agriculture sector, as a proportion of available freshwater resources.

data.Name: Water consumption
data.Definition: the level of freshwater withdrawal by domestic sector, as a proportion of available freshwater resources.

data.Name: Water consumption
data.Definition: the level of freshwater withdrawal by industry sector, as a proportion of available freshwater resources.

data.Name: Forest area
data.Definition: Forest area in million hectares
data.Source: Statistics Agency under the President of the Republic of Uzbekistan

data.Name: Forest area
data.Definition: the share % of the total land area covered by forest. The  indicator shows if Uzbekistan has experienced afforestation or massive deforestation over the years.
data.Source: Statistics Agency under the President of the Republic of Uzbekistan

data.Name: Forest stock
data.Definition: It is the volume over the bark of all living trees with a minimum diameter of 10 cm at breast height, including the stem from ground level up to a top diameter of 0 cm (excluding branches) (OECD). The indicator provides information about wood resources measured in millions of cubic metres (m3). It also provides the basis for estimating the amount of CO₂ the forest contains.
data.Source: Statistics Agency under the President of the Republic of Uzbekistan

data.Name: Land area
data.Definition: Uzbekistans surface area in thousand Km2, excluding area under inland water bodies (rivers and lakes).
data.Source: Statistics Agency under the President of the Republic of Uzbekistan

data.Name: Agriculture land
data.Definition: the land area  in thousand Km2 that is arable (temporary crops), under permanent crops and permanent pastures

data.Name: Agriculture land
data.Definition: the share % of land area that is arable (temporary crops), under permanent crops and permanent pastures

data.Name: Cultivated (arable) land
data.Definition: part of the agricultural land that is cultivated annually (arable land) for growing food and feed.

data.Name: Natural gas production and consumption
data.Definition: Volume (billion m3) of natural gas produced annually in uzbekistan
data.Source: Statistics Agency under the President of the Republic of Uzbekistan

data.Name: Natural gas production and consumption
data.Definition: Volume (billion m3) of natural gas consumed annually in Uzbekustan
data.Source: Statistics Agency under the President of the Republic of Uzbekistan

data.Name: Protected areas
data.Definition: national parks, nature reserves and wildlife sanctuaries designated by national authorities as scientific reserves with limited public access
data.Source: Statistics Agency under the President of the Republic of Uzbekistan

data.Name: Threatened species
data.Definition: critically endangered and vulnerable  plant species i.e., those plants in danger of extinction or soon likely to be.

data.Name: Threatened species
data.Definition: critically endangered and vulnerable  animal species i.e., those animals in danger of extinction or soon likely to be. Number of species  threatened by extinction among species assessed or known.

data.Name: Annual mean temperature
data.Definition: annual mean surface temperature expressed in degree Celsius (°C).

data.Name: Air pollution
data.Definition: the amount of pollutants emitted into the atmosphere in thousand tonnes of pollutants per year.
data.Source: Statistics Agency under the President of the Republic of Uzbekistan

data.Name: Population exposure to air pollution by PM:
data.Definition: The standard measure of air pollution computes the mean annual concentration of fine suspended particles of less than 2.5 microns in diameter (PM2.5). The concentration of pollutants is expressed in micrograms per cubic metre of air (µg per m3) – a unit of air pollution measurement. The public health unhealthy level of average concentration is more than 35µg/m3

data.Name: Population exposure to air pollution by PM
data.Definition: Percentage of the population exposed to air pollution    above the average concentration of 35µg/m3 of air pollution. the proportion of the population exposed to outdoor air pollution concentration of average PM2.5 to which a typical resident is exposed throughout a year (derived from satellite observation or ground monitoring and measured in μg/m³).

data.Name: Death due to respiratory disease
data.Definition: Mortality from exposure to PM2.5 in deaths per million inhabitants

data.Name: Death due to respiratory disease
data.Definition: Welfare costs from exposure to PM2.5 expressed in GDP equivalent (PPP) percentage points

data.Name: Death due to respiratory disease
data.Definition: mortality induced by exposure to ozone gas pollution, which causes lung problems and premature death

data.Name: Death due to respiratory disease
data.Definition: Welfare costs due to exposure to ozone in  GDP equivalent percentage points

data.Name: Death due to respiratory disease
data.Definition: Mortality from exposure to lead in deaths per million inhabitants. Humans may be exposed to lead by eating food and drinking water contaminated with lead, which mostly occurs in industry sectors.

data.Name: Death due to respiratory disease
data.Definition: Welfare costs from mortality due to exposure to lead in GDP equivalent percentage points.

data.Name: Death due to respiratory disease
data.Definition: Death due to respiratory disease: In percentage of all deaths.

data.Name: Share of households with access to safe drinking water
data.Definition: households using improved drinking water sources, which include piped water into dwellings, yards or plots, public taps or standpipes, boreholes, or tube wells, protected dug wells, protected springs, packaged water, delivered water and rainwater. Improved water sources should be located on the premises, available when needed and contamination-free. The indicator constitutes a key component in measuring the environmental quality of life (OECD, 2017). It measures the proportion (percentage) of households with access to safe drinking water sources not shared with other houses.

data.Name: Share of households with access to sewerage treatment
data.Definition: Percentage of households connected to public sewerage treatment.  Households connected to an urban wastewater collecting system through public sewerage network. Individual private treatment facilities such as septic tanks are not covered.

data.Name: Population using improved sanitation
data.Definition: Percentage of the population using improved sanitation facilities with basic handwashing facilities and toilets, including flush or pour-flush toilets to sewerage systems, septic tanks, or pit latrines, ventilated improved pit latrines, pit latrines with a slab and composting toilets. This indicator measures the proportion of the population with access to basic sanitation services (e.g., hand washing).

data.Name: Environment-related innovations
data.Definition: Percentage share of environment-related inventions of all domestic technologies. Inventions to ensure the protection and recovery of the environment. These are inventions for various environment-related technologies, including environmental management, water-related adaptation and climate change mitigation technologies.The indicator measures the number of new products and technologies developed domestically based on patent data extracted from worldwide patent statistical database (PATSTAT).

data.Name: Environment-related innovations
data.Definition: Percentage share of environment-related inventions of all world technologies. Inventions to ensure the protection and recovery of the environment. These are inventions for various environment-related technologies, including environmental management, water-related adaptation and climate change mitigation technologies.The indicator measures the number of new products and technologies developed domestically based on patent data extracted from worldwide patent statistical database (PATSTAT).

data.Name: Environment-related innovations:
data.Definition: Number of environment-related inventions per person in Uzbekistan. Inventions to ensure the protection and recovery of the environment. These are inventions for various environment-related technologies, including environmental management, water-related adaptation and climate change mitigation technologies.The indicator measures the number of new products and technologies developed domestically based on patent data extracted from worldwide patent statistical database (PATSTAT).

data.Name: Public expenditures in environmental protection
data.Definition: Share of public budget for environmental protection. E.g., environmental research and development in renewable energy sources.
data.Source: Ministry for Ecology, Environmental Protection and Climate Change MEEPCCh

data.Name: Public expenditures in environmental protection
data.Definition: Percentage of total GDP, government expenditure on green growth (GG). This measures how much the government invests in green initiatives

data.Name: Public expenditures in environmental protection
data.Definition: Share of public budget for SDG-13.

data.Name: Environment-related tax revenues
data.Definition: Share of income collected by the government through environment-related taxes of all revenues.
data.Source: Ministry for Ecology, Environmental Protection and Climate Change MEEPCCh

data.Name: Environment-related subsidies
data.Definition: government support to assist the energy sector to keep prices low.  The indicator measures benefits and privileges provided to the oil energy sectors.

data.Name: Environment-related subsidies
data.Definition: government support to assist the electric energy sector to keep prices low.  The indicator measures benefits and privileges provided to the energy sectors.

data.Name: Environment-related subsidies
data.Definition: government support to assist the natural gas energy sector to keep prices low.  The indicator measures benefits and privileges provided to the oil energy sectors.

data.Name: Price of fuel
data.Definition: Real price per litre for diesel and petrol (in USD 2015) using purchasing power parity (PPP)

data.Name: Price of fuel
data.Definition: Real price per litre for diesel and petrol (in USD 2015) using purchasing power parity (PPP)

data.Name: Price of fuel
data.Definition: Average nominal retail price of petrol per litter (authors calculation

data.Name: Price per kWh of electricity
data.Definition: measures changes in the end-user price for electricity (residential and industry use), using 2015 price as base year. The dynamics in the energy tariffs over time show policy reforms for valuing energy sources

data.Name: Price per kWh of electricity
data.Definition: measures changes in the end-user price for electricity (residential and industry use), using 2015 price as base year. The dynamics in the energy tariffs over time show policy reforms for valuing energy sources

data.Name: Real GDP
data.Definition: gross domestic product of Uzbekistan in local currency unit calculated at constant prices by the production method with reference to previous year's price.
data.Source: Statistics Agency under the President of the Republic of Uzbekistan

data.Name: GDP per capita
data.Definition: average annual income of the people in Uzbekistan (annual real GDP     divided by the annual population number in UZS. It is the ratio of real GDP to the annual permanent population.
data.Source: Statistics Agency under the President of the Republic of Uzbekistan

data.Name: Real GDP
data.Definition: annual percentage change in real GDP values.
data.Source: Statistics Agency under the President of the Republic of Uzbekistan

data.Name: GDP structure
data.Definition: percentage share of value added in GDP by the agriculture sector in Uzbekistan.
data.Source: Statistics Agency under the President of the Republic of Uzbekistan

data.Name: GDP structure
data.Definition: percentage share of value added in GDP by the industry sector in Uzbekistan
data.Source: Statistics Agency under the President of the Republic of Uzbekistan

data.Name: GDP structure
data.Definition: percentage share of value added in GDP by the service sector in Uzbekistan
data.Source: Statistics Agency under the President of the Republic of Uzbekistan

data.Name: CPI
data.Definition: annual percentage change in the price of a basket of commodities based on SA calculation of price data in the consumer market. It shows the changes in the value of inflation in the economy for a fixed set of consumer goods and services consumed by the population in Uzbekistan.
data.Source: Statistics Agency under the President of the Republic of Uzbekistan

data.Name: Export and import values of goods and services in million USD. Export:
data.Definition: transaction of goods and services from Uzbekistan to a foreign state in monetary value, in million USD
data.Source: Statistics Agency under the President of the Republic of Uzbekistan

data.Name: Export and import values of goods and services in million USD. Import:
data.Definition: transaction of goods and services from a foreign state to Uzbekistan in monetary value, in million USD.
data.Source: Statistics Agency under the President of the Republic of Uzbekistan

data.Name: Share of low-income population
data.Definition: the share of the population below income estimates of  2 100 kilocalories per day, as recommended by the World Bank. It shows the percentage of the population with income less than a given amount.
data.Source: Statistics Agency under the President of the Republic of Uzbekistan

data.Name: Gini coefficient
data.Definition: an index number between 0 in the case of perfect income equality and 1 in the case of perfect   income inequality based on the comparison of cumulative proportions of the population against cumulative proportions of income they receive.
data.Source: Statistics Agency under the President of the Republic of Uzbekistan

data.Name: Labor force
data.Definition: the proportion of the population aged 15 and older that is economically active during a specified period.
data.Source: Statistics Agency under the President of the Republic of Uzbekistan

data.Name: Employment
data.Definition: persons of working age engaged in any activity to produce goods or provide services for pay or profit, whether at work during the reference period or not at work due to temporary absence from a job or working-time arrangement. The employment rate here in the report is a proportion (percentage) of the labour force employed
data.Source: Statistics Agency under the President of the Republic of Uzbekistan

data.Name: Employment by sector
data.Definition: percentage of total employment by agriculture sector of the economy

data.Name: Employment by sector
data.Definition: percentage of total employment by industry sector of the economy

data.Name: Employment by sector
data.Definition: percentage of total employment by service sector of the economy

data.Name: School gross enrolment ratio
data.Definition: the ratio of total enrolment, regardless of age, to the population of the age group that officially corresponds to the level of education shown-at primary levels.

data.Name: School gross enrolment ratio
data.Definition: the ratio of total enrolment, regardless of age, to the population of the age group that officially corresponds to the level of education at secondary level.

data.Name: School gross enrolment ratio
data.Definition: the ratio of total enrolment, regardless of age, to the population of the age group that officially corresponds to the level of education at tertiary level.

data.Name: Total population
data.Definition: Number of people permanently living in Uzbekistan at the beginning of the year.
data.Source: Statistics Agency under the President of the Republic of Uzbekistan

data.Name: Life expectancy
data.Definition: average number of years a newborn infant in Uzbekistan would live if prevailing patterns of mortality at the time of its birth were to stay the same throughout its life.
data.Source: Statistics Agency under the President of the Republic of Uzbekistan

data.Name: Life expectancy
data.Definition: average number of years a newborn infant male in Uzbekistan would live.
data.Source: Statistics Agency under the President of the Republic of Uzbekistan

data.Name: Life expectancy
data.Definition: average number of years a newborn infant  female in Uzbekistan would live.
data.Source: Statistics Agency under the President of the Republic of Uzbekistan

data.Name: Net external migration
data.Definition: the net total of migrants during the period (i.e. the number of immigrants minus the number of emigrants, including citizens and noncitizens)
